title: Ticket #7535: startd should allow slots to be assigned specific custom resources
description:
When the Startd creates a slot of any type (p-slot, d-slot, or static slot) it does so by parsing a string of the form that the SLOT_TYPE_<N> configuration knob reads. This is a complicated, semi free-form request for resources that looks like this 
<resource_tag1>=<quantity>, <resource_tag2>=<quantity>, ...
example: 
Cpus=1/4, Memory=4096, Gpus=1

<quantity> may be an integer, a fraction, or a percentage, or the special values auto and minimal

At a minimum we need to extend this to allow a specific instance or instances of a non-fungible resource, (e.g. GPUS) to be specified; Possibly like this: 

Cpus=2, Memory=4000, Gpus="CUDA2,CUDA3"
.

If we make this change, then P-slots and static slots could be configured to have specific GPUs assigned to them. And with a small amount of additional code we could construct the provisioning string for d-slots to assign specific GPUs there also. The mechanism for indicating to the STARTD what GPU assignments are desired would be left to a future ticket.

The above syntax, while sufficient, would be a bit of a PITA to use - So we should probably allow some sort of smart assignment here such as 

Cpus=2, Gpus=(DeviceName:*Tesla*)
which would indicate that we want to assign a GPU that has a CUDA<n>DeviceName attribute that matches /Tesla*/

Some things we need to consider:

  1. currently the provisioning syntax splits on the usual string list characters and then treats each item as a resource assignment. This means specification of the <quantity> cannot contain either spaces or commas - we should probably change that
  2. we should probably pick a syntax that can survive being imbedded into a classad attribute value so that the schedd can make requests.
  3. as a part of this work, we should stop advertising attributes of GPUs that are not assigned to the slot in the slot, and should remove the GPU id prefix from the attributes that are assigned to the slot.
